sen.j: 向島駅（むかいじまえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区向島東定請にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Mukaijima Higashi-Jouke, Fushiku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Mukaijima Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Mukaijima Higashi-Jouke, in the Fushiku ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Mukaijima Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation line.
Mukaijima Station, located in Mukaijima Higashi-Jouke, in the Fushimi ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 向島ニュータウンへの最寄り駅である。
sen.e: It is the nearest station to Mukaijima New Town.
It is the nearest station to Mukaijima New Town.
It is the nearest station to Mukaijima New Town.

sen.j: 駅西側は巨椋池を干拓してできた水田が広がり、逆に東側は団地や住宅が立ち並び、東西で風景が異なる。
sen.e: Rice paddies created by draining Ogura-ike Pond spread out to the west of the station, but the landscape on the east side is in stark contrast crowded with a housing complex and private residences.

Rice paddies created by draining Ogura-ike Pond spread out to the west of the station, but the landscape on the east side is in stark contrast, being crowded with a housing complex and private residences.

Rice paddies created by draining Ogura-ike Pond spread out to the west of the station, but the landscape on the east side is in stark contrast, being crowded with a housing complex and private residences.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 島式2面4線のホームを持つ待避可能な橋上駅。
sen.e: Station facilities are elevated above two "Island" platforms and four tracks on which slow trains taking refuge can standby.
The station facilities are elevated above two "island" platforms and four tracks on which slow trains taking refuge can stand by.
The station facilities comprise elevated two island platforms and four tracks on which slow trains taking refuge can stand by.

sen.j: 急行が停車する近鉄丹波橋駅や桃山御陵前駅で列車待避ができないため、この駅で待避ができるようになっている。
sen.e: Trains can take refuge at this station as they cannot do so at Kintetsu Tamba and Momoyama Goryo-mae Stations where express trains stop.
Trains can take refuge at this station since they can't do so at the Kintetsu Tamba and Momoyama Goryo-mae stations, where express trains stop.
Trains can take refuge at this station since they can't do so at the Kintetsu Tambabashi and Momoyama Goryo-mae stations, where express trains stop.

sen.j: 4番線には西大寺方面への出発信号機があり、折り返し運転が出来る構造である(ただし通常ダイヤでは回送のみ)。
sen.e: A departure signal is installed for Track #4 departues towards Saidai-ji Temple and structured to execute shuttle service, (but limited to deadheads only per ordinary timetable.)
A departure signal is installed for Track No. 4 departures toward Saidaiji Temple; it is structured to execute shuttle service (but limited to deadheads only per ordinary timetable).
A departure signal is installed for Platform 4 departures toward Saidaiji; it is structured to execute shuttle service but is limited to deadheads only per the ordinary timetable.
sen.cmt: Saidaji としました。「No.番線」の表記を統一

sen.j: その為京都～向島間で異常が発生し運転見合わせになった場合、この駅で折り返し運転を行う。
sen.e: Therefore, shuttle service is provided from this station in the event an accident occurs between Kyoto and Mukaijima Stations suspending operations.
Therefore, shuttle service is provided from this station in the event operations are suspended due to an accident occurring between the Kyoto and Mukaijima stations.
Therefore, shuttle service is provided from this station in the event operations are suspended due to an accident occurring between the Kyoto and Mukaijima stations.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Platforms' effective length accommodates six cars.
The platform length is sufficient to accommodate six cars.
The platform length is sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: また、改札階に売店がある。
sen.e: A kiosk stall can be found near ticket gates.
A kiosk stall can be found near the ticket gates.
A kiosk stall can be found on the same floor as the ticket gates.

sen.j: 東西双方に出入口があり、駅東側にはバスロータリーがある。
sen.e: Access to station facilities is possible from both east and west sides and a bus boarding station is located on the east side.
Access to station facilities is possible from both the east and west sides, and a bus boarding station is located on the east side.
Access to station facilities is possible from both the east and west sides, and a bus boarding station is located on the east side.

sen.j: 改札口は元来1箇所のみであったが、2006年2月16日にエレベーターの供用開始と同時にエレベーター専用改札口が新設され、2箇所となった。
sen.e: Ticket gates existed at only one place until a separate gate was installed solely for users of a newly installed elevator which became usable on Feb. 16, 2006.
Ticket gates were once found in just one location until a separate gate was installed solely for users of a newly installed elevator, which became usable on February 16, 2006.
Ticket gates were once found in just one location until a separate gate was installed solely for users of a newly installed elevator, which became usable on February 16, 2006.

sen.j: ホームにはLED列車案内表示装置が各番線に1機設置され、2007年には非常通報ボタンが設置された。
sen.e: One LED lit train direction board is installed on each platform and an emergency call button installed in 2007.
One LED lit train direction board is installed on each platform, and an emergency call button was installed in 2007.
One LED train direction board is installed on each platform, and an emergency call button was installed in 2007.
sen.cmt: LED train direction boardで統一しました。

sen.j: 駅開業から1980年代半ばごろまでは待避線には線路が敷設されておらず、現在の2・3番のりばのみで営業していた。
sen.e: From the time the station opened till around the mid 80s, a refuge track did not exist and operations were managed by only the present No.2 and No.3 tracks.
From the time the station opened till around the mid-1980s, there was no refuge track and operations were managed by only the present No. 2 and No. 3 tracks.
From the time the station opened till around the mid-1980s, there was no refuge track and operations were managed by only the present Platform 2 and Platform 3.

sen.j: なお特急券・定期券とも購入可能。
sen.e: Both limited express train tickets and commutation passes can be purchased at this station.
Limited express train tickets and commutation passes can be purchased at this station.
Limited express train tickets and commuter passes can be purchased at this station.
sen.cmt: commuter passで他ファイルと統一

sen.j: また自動改札機は東芝製が設置されており、赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture and the red-colored automated ticket gates can process two tickets together when exiting and are PiTaPa Card and ICOCA Card compatible.
The red-colored, automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba; they can process two tickets together when exiting and are compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
The red-colored, automated ticket gates (EG-2000) were manufactured by Toshiba; they can process two tickets together when exiting and are compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 急行の臨時停車
sen.e: Express train temporary stops
Express train temporary stops
Express train temporary stops

sen.j: 洛南高校体育祭が種智院大学の向島グラウンドで開催される時は急行が臨時停車することがある。
sen.e: Express trains may at times make temporary stops when Rakunan High School's Athletic Meet is held at Shuchiin University's Mukaijima Ground.
Express trains may at times make temporary stops when Rakunan High School athletics meets are held at Shuchiin University's Mukaijima Ground.
Express trains may at times make temporary stops when Rakunan High School athletics meets are held at Shuchiin University's Mukaijima Ground.

sen.j: また、ホームでは臨時停車用の急行の自動放送が流れる。
sen.e: Automated announcements of express train making temporary stops are made at station platforms.
Automated announcements of express trains making temporary stops are made at the station platforms.
Automated announcements of express trains making temporary stops are made at the station platforms.

sen.j: 特に下りについては小倉駅 (京都府)、伊勢田駅に停車しない旨の誤乗防止放送が流れる。
sen.e: Announcements are expressly made for down trains that Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Iseda Station will be overpassed to prevent mistaken boarding.
Announcements are expressly made for down trains that Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Iseda Station will overpass in order to prevent mistaken boarding.
In order to prevent mistaken boarding, announcements are expressly made for down trains that Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Iseda Station will be bypassed.

sen.j: LED列車案内表示は編成両数のみ表示される。
sen.e: An LED train direction board indicates only the composition of trains.
An LED train direction board indicates only the composition of trains.
The LED train direction board indicates only the composition of trains.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は18,340人。
sen.e: A survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers who got and off at this station on that day was 18,340.
A survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers who got and off at this station on that day was 18,340.
A survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers who got on and off at this station on that day was 18,340.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、39位。
sen.e: Ranked 39th amongst all Kintetsu stations (323 stations on that date) which were subject to the survey.
It ranked thirty-ninth among all Kintetsu stations (323 stations on that date) that were subject to the survey.
It ranked thirty-ninth among all Kintetsu stations (323 stations on that date) that were subject to the survey.

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、8位。
sen.e: Ranked 8th amongst stations of the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidai Station.)
It ranked eighth among the stations of the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidai Station).
It ranked eighth among the stations of the Kyoto Line (a total of 26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、6位。
sen.e: Ranked 6th amongst Kintetsu stations (23 stations) in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked sixth among Kintetsu stations (23 stations) in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked sixth among Kintetsu stations (23 stations) in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 75系統 大川原（奈良交通京都営業所） 行（日曜・祝日1便のみ）
sen.e: Route No.75: For Ogawara (Nara Kotsu Kyoto Office) (Only one trip a day on Sundays and holidays)
Route No. 75: For Ogawara (Nara Kotsu Kyoto Office) (Only one trip a day on Sundays and holidays)
Route No. 75: for Ogawara (Nara Kotsu Kyoto Office) (Only one trip a day on Sundays and holidays)

sen.j: かつては、京都駅と奈良を結ぶ路線が経由していた。
sen.e: The route linking Kyoto Station and Nara at one time used to pass through here.
The route linking Kyoto Station and Nara once passed through here.
The route linking Kyoto Station and Nara once passed through here.

sen.j: 近鉄バス（当時は近畿日本鉄道）、奈良交通と京阪バスが運行したが、1998年までに全廃されている。
sen.e: Kintetsu Bus (then Kintetsu Railways,) Nara Kotsu and Keihan Bus operated bus routes but were totally abolished by 1998.
Kintetsu Bus (then Kintetsu Railways), Nara Kotsu and Keihan Bus operated bus routes but were totally abolished by 1998.
Kintetsu Bus (then Kintetsu Railways), Nara Kotsu and Keihan Bus operated bus routes but were totally abolished by 1998.

sen.j: 現在、近鉄バスや奈良交通は京都市内では上記路線のみ運行する。
sen.e: Kintetsu Bus and Nara Kotsu now only operate the above-mentioned routes in Kyoto City.
Kintetsu Bus and Nara Kotsu now only operate the above-mentioned routes in Kyoto City.
Kintetsu Bus and Nara Kotsu now only operate the above-mentioned routes in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1979年（昭和54年）3月30日 開業。
sen.e: Opened on March 30, 1979.
It opened on March 30, 1979.
March 30, 1979: The station opened.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）3月15日 準急停車駅に昇格。
sen.e: Upgraded to local express stopping station on March 15, 2000.
It was upgraded to a local express stopping station on March 15, 2000.
March 15, 2000: The station was upgraded to a semi-express stopping station.
sen.cmt: 準急→semi express年表表記に統一

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）2月16日 エレベーターと専用改札口の供用開始。
sen.e: Feb. 16, 200, activation date of elevator and exclusive ticket gate.
The elevator and exclusive ticket gate were activated on February 16, 2000.
February 16, 2000: The elevator and exclusive ticket gate were activated.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: Use of PiTaPi Cards commenced April 1, 2007.
PiTaPi card usage commenced on April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa cards commenced.
